data.text: @Jonath9999 @_mbdr_ Why is their health the responsibility of everyone else?  Oh and you were perfectly fine with an apartheid system for the unvaxxed.   All of you tyrants can piss off.

@_mbdr_ @AudreyYeoCH Not every country has a CDC. Most have National Public Health Institutes. These are also sometimes not the highest authority on health matter, or the holders of Data, as with Denmark, it is a public sector research institute that has this role. Getting the labels right matters.
@_mbdr_ @CBroendsholmA Dear Megan we’re thinking about what gaslight we will use in our reply.
@_mbdr_ Apartheid Day for #immunocompromised People and their family.
@a10daze____ @Ham_Den_Vilde @RasMitch @_mbdr_ These numbers aren’t referring to Denmark; they’re referring to the US.

@Ham_Den_Vilde @RasMitch @_mbdr_ You’re the one referring to percent, I’m stating actual counts: 200,00 annual deaths isn’t an impossible outcome if we’ve just lived through over 400,000 deaths/year for two years straight now.

@MBAbrahamsson @Ham_Den_Vilde @RasMitch @_mbdr_ 1) Deaths with Covid
2) US population is 55 times greater
3) Danes are relatively healthy
Denmark will not even see 5000 annual deaths and out of those 1000 at most is attributable to covid with another 1000 marginally foreshortening lives of elderly.

Doing something kills more.
